title: AWS ANZ Webinar Series - An Introduction to the Well Architected Framework
description:
Register for our upcoming webinars at - https://amzn.to/2MN04j1.
The AWS Well-Architected Framework enables customers to understand best practices around security, reliability, performance, cost optimization and operational excellence when building systems on AWS. This approach helps customers make informed decisions and weigh the pros and cons of application design patterns for the cloud.

In this one hour webinar, you'll learn how to use the Well- Architected Framework to follow AWS guidelines and best practices for your architecture on AWS.

title: Are you Well Architected?
description:
Learn more about AWS at – https://amzn.to/2wvRC1W 
Most businesses depend on a portfolio of technology solutions to operate and be successful every day. How do you know if you and your team are following best practice, or what the risks in your architectures might be? This session will show how the AWS Well-Architected framework provides prescriptive architectural advice, and how the AWS Well-Architected Tool allows you to measure and improve your technology portfolio. We will explain how other customers are using AWS Well-Architected in their business, and we’ll share insights into what we have learned from reviewing tens of thousands of architectures across Operational Excellence, Security, Reliability, Performance Efficiency, and Cost Optimization.

title: AWS re:Inforce 2019: Security Best Practices the Well-Architected Way (SDD318)
description: As you continually evolve your use of the AWS platform, it’s important to consider ways to improve your security posture and take advantage of new security services and features. In this advanced session, we share architectural patterns for meeting common challenges, service limits and tips, tricks, and ways to continually evaluate your architecture against best practices. Automation and tools are featured throughout, and there will be code giveaways! Be prepared for a technically deep session on AWS security.

title: Well-Architected for Security: Advanced Session
description:
Learn more about AWS at - http://amzn.to/2fZ7j9w.
This advanced technical session covers architecture patterns for different workloads, IAM policy tips & tricks, and how to implement security automation and forensics. Be prepared for a technically deep session on AWS security.

title: So You Want to be Well-Architected?
description: Presenter: Brian Farnhill, Solutions Architect, Amazon Web Services

title: Live Coding with AWS | Well Architected Reliability
description:
For more information on Live Coding with AWS, visit http://amzn.to/2hdQHyG.
The Well-Architected framework has been developed to help cloud architects build the most secure, high-performing, resilient, and efficient infrastructure possible for their applications. This framework provides a consistent approach for customers and partners to evaluate architectures, and provides guidance to help implement designs that will scale with your application needs over time.

Live Coding with AWS is an interactive Twitch show on https://www.twitch.tv/aws, where the broadcasters explore cloud computing topics and AWS services from the developer's perspective, building everything from serverless web apps to machine learning models.

title: AWS Well-Architected Framework | Serverless Application Lens
description: To catch up on more AWS Twitch streams and see the upcoming calendar, visit: http://amzn.to/2Io8KLA. In this interactive coding session, AWS Sr Technical Evangelist Julio Faerman and AWS Solution Architect Heitor Lessa, used the AWS Well-Architected Framework for designing and guiding implementation of architectural best practices.

title: Building Well-Architected Applications - Framework Review
description:
Learn more about the AWS Twitch Channel at - https://amzn.to/2PEU1ik.
The Well-Architected framework has been developed to help cloud architects build the most secure, high-performing, resilient, and efficient infrastructure possible for their applications. This framework provides a consistent approach for customers and partners to evaluate architectures, and provides guidance to help implement designs that will scale with your application needs over time.

title: Building Well-Architected Applications | Reliability Pillar
description:
Join Julio Faerman, Sr Technical Evangelist, for live coding, tutorials, demos and discussions of building applications using the Well-Architected Framework. Learn more at - https://amzn.to/2wd0Qjb.

The Well-Architected framework has been developed to help cloud architects build the most secure, high-performing, resilient, and efficient infrastructure possible for their applications. This framework provides a consistent approach for customers and partners to evaluate architectures, and provides guidance to help implement designs that will scale with your application needs over time.

title: Live Coding with AWS | Well-Architected Applications
description:
For more information on Live Coding with AWS, visit http://amzn.to/2eCJPXe.
The Well-Architected framework has been developed to help cloud architects build the most secure, high-performing, resilient, and efficient infrastructure possible for their applications. This framework provides a consistent approach for customers and partners to evaluate architectures, and provides guidance to help implement designs that will scale with your application needs over time.

Live Coding with AWS is an interactive, Twitch show on https://www.twitch.tv/aws, where the broadcasters explore cloud computing topics and AWS services from the developer's perspective, building everything from serverless web apps to machine learning models.

title: AWS re:Invent 2016: Achieving Agility by Following Well-Architected Framework Principles (ARC203)
description: The AWS Well-Architected Framework enables customers to understand best practices around security, reliability, performance, and cost optimization when building systems on AWS. This approach helps customers make informed decisions and weigh the pros and cons of application design patterns for the cloud. In this session, you'll learn how National Instruments used the Well-Architected Framework to follow AWS guidelines and best practices. By developing a strategy based on the AWS Well-Architected Framework, National Instruments was able to triple the number of applications running in the cloud without additional head count, significantly increase the frequency of code deployments, and reduce deployment times from two weeks to a single day. As a result, National Instruments was able to deliver a more scalable, dynamic, and resilient LabVIEW platform with agility.

title: Well-Architected Solutions - Building Continuous Delivery
description:
Learn more about Twitch at - https://amzn.to/2JvWwld.
The Well-Architected framework has been developed to help cloud architects build the most secure, high-performing, resilient, and efficient infrastructure possible for their applications. This framework provides a consistent approach for customers and partners to evaluate architectures, and provides guidance to help implement designs that will scale with your application needs over time. https://aws.amazon.com/architecture/well-architected/

In this series we've been managing infrastructure as code with AWS CloudFormation along with other tools. In this episode we chained them together in the services for Continuous Delivery: AWS CodeStar, AWS CodeCommit, AWS CodeBuild and AWS CodePipeline.

title: Well-Architected Solutions - Load Testing 101
description:
Learn more about the AWS Well-Architected framework at - https://amzn.to/2N2CGTG.
The Well-Architected framework has been developed to help cloud architects build the most secure, high-performing, resilient, and efficient infrastructure possible for their applications. This framework provides a consistent approach for customers and partners to evaluate architectures, and provides guidance to help implement designs that will scale with your application needs over time. https://aws.amazon.com/architecture/well-architected/

In this episode, we continued the implementation of the reliability pillar, with best practices for how systems adapt to changes in demand. To demonstrate, we produced HTTP requests using load generators to simulate real users. We built a simple application and started firing at it, using the design guidelines from the Well-Architected Framework. The infrastructure will be defined as code using CloudFormation and Elastic Beanstalk. We evaluated some options for load testing and decided together on our selection for this series.

title: Well-Architected Solutions - Load Testing for Serverless Applications
description:
Learn more about the AWS Twitch Channel at - https://amzn.to/2Cpkuil.
The Well-Architected framework has been developed to help cloud architects build the most secure, high-performing, resilient, and efficient infrastructure possible for their applications. This framework provides a consistent approach for customers and partners to evaluate architectures, and provides guidance to help implement designs that will scale with your application needs over time.

In this episode, we continued the implementation of the reliability pillar, with best practices for how systems adapt to changes in demand. To demonstrate, we produced HTTP requests using load generators to simulate real users. We built a simple application and start firing at it, using the design guidelines from the Well-Architected Framework. The infrastructure will be defined as code using CloudFormation and Elastic Beanstalk.

For more Well-Architected videos, visit -  https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLhr1KZpdzukf1ERxT2lJnkpsmTPyG0_cC

title: AWS re:Invent 2018: Developing Well-Architected Android Apps with AWS (MOB302)
description: The architecture of modern native mobile apps is an ever-changing field. In this session, we review the latest Android architecture blueprints for native apps and how you can use these architecture components to easily authenticate and engage users, access data and build responsive mobile apps.

title: Well-Architected Solutions - Load Testing for Containers
description:
Learn more about Twitch at - https://amzn.to/2xQq2g7.
Join Julio Faerman, Sr Technical Evangelist, for live coding, tutorials, demos and discussions of building apps using the Well-Architected framework.

title: Well-Architected Solutions - Load Testing for Databases
description:
Learn more about Twitch at - https://amzn.to/2P336lf.
The Well-Architected framework has been developed to help cloud architects build the most secure, high-performing, resilient, and efficient infrastructure possible for their applications. This framework provides a consistent approach for customers and partners to evaluate architectures, and provides guidance to help implement designs that will scale with your application needs over time. https://aws.amazon.com/architecture/well-architected/

In this episode we made our simulation more realistic by adding databases, as they are frequently a scalability bottleneck. We added databases to our test cases and understand how systems can adapt to load in the data tier.

title: A Well-Architected Journey
description:
Learn more about WS Well-Architected Partner Program at - https://amzn.to/2QkhFTs
Hear from AWS Well-Architected Partners on how AWS Well-Architected has impacted their customers and their business. AWS Well-Architected Partners from 4 different GEOs describe their journeys in integrating AWS Well-Architected into their practice.

title: AWS re:Invent 2019: Cox Automotive: AWS Well-Architected Results on 200+ platforms (ARC212-R1)
description: How do you know if you and your team are following cloud architecture best practices? How do you assess your potential risks? This session shows how the AWS Well-Architected Framework provides prescriptive architectural advice, and how the AWS Well-Architected Tool allows you to improve your technology portfolio. Hear executives from Cox Automotive explain how the company uses AWS Well-Architected as part of a scorecard across more than 200 platforms to health-check the Cox Automotive products. Learn how the scorecard works to drive resource and investment decisions, and how it helps measure profitability, technology risk, and engineering maturity.

title: Optimizing Your Cloud With a Well-Architected Review
description:
Cloud adoption enables valuable benefits, from improved scalability and cost optimization to much greater levels of security. But are you getting the most out of your existing solution? In this webinar you can find out how to optimize your cloud with a Well-Architected Review.

Learn more about Swisscom at https://go.aws/2AMJi3k

title: AWS Summit Online ASEAN 2020 | Security Best Practices: The Well-architected Way
description:
As you continually evolve your use of AWS, it’s important to consider ways to improve your security posture and take advantage of new security services and features. In this session, you explore architectural patterns for meeting common challenges, learn about service limits, and hear some tips and tricks, as well as learn ways to continually evaluate your architecture against best practices. Automation and tools are featured throughout, and we also include code giveaways!

AWS Speaker: Tim Robinson, Well Architected Partner Solutions Architect, APAC, AWS
